bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, May 9, 1919

div1.p: Blue directs Carter to Washington, D.C. for a conference on malaria work.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, May 9, 1919
div1.opener:
E.E.M.
RMB
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
May 9, 1919.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
New Orleans, Louisiana.
Sir:
div1.p:
Bureau telegram of May 9, 1919, as follows, is
hereby confirmed:

“Gorman's leave fifteen days approved stop
Allen detailed Texarkana to arrive May seventeenth
stop Proceed Bureau attend conference May
fifteenth stop Fricks given orders same effect.”

In accordance with the above instructions you
will proceed to the Bureau for a conference on May 15th,
regarding the future plans of the Service as to malaria
work and the establishment of new headquarters for this
work. Upon the completion of this conference you will
resume your supervision of malaria investigations in
accordance with Bureau orders of April 12, 1919.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. JC
J
The expenses incurred in carrying out the fore-
going instructions are hereby authorized.
(Jouett Shouce)
Rett Wouse
Assistant Secretary.
RB
B
